abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Fifth Sui Northern
            Gas Pipeline Project for Pakistan was satisfactory. The
            project achieved its objectives, its impact has been
            significant, sustainability is likely, and both the Bank and
            Borrower performed satisfactorily. Several lessons can be
            learned from this project. First, it is important to
            establish a procurement plan and schedule that is compatible
            with the overall project schedule. Pre-qualification of
            local contractors and preparation of well-defined equipment
            specifications would be helpful in achieving project
            schedule and quality objectives. Second, it is important to
            establish a realistic implementation schedule in order to
            avoid the danger of underestimating costs and overestimating
            benefits. Also, a realistic schedule will eliminate the
            unnecessary expenditure of administrative time to negotiate
            and approve loan extensions. Lastly, co-financing represents
            a significant source of external funds for energy projects.
